summary: This video highlights IONOS' strategic partnership with Nextcloud, emphasizing the importance of data sovereignty in the digital landscape. It showcases IONOS' cloud offerings and competitive advantages, positioning the company as a leading European alternative to hyperscalers.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man standing in front of a white background, wearing a black cardigan over a white shirt. He appears to be speaking, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. To his left, a large screen displays various graphics and text. Initially, the screen shows a dark blue background with the words "IONOS CLOUD" and "nextcloud" along with a logo, and the name "Dr. Martin Endress, CCO IONOS" at the bottom. The background graphic resembles a network or data visualization. As the video progresses, the screen changes to a lighter blue background with the text "IONOS CLOUD and nextcloud share the same vision" and a quote from Achim Weig, CEO IONOS, emphasizing the partnership's focus on European data sovereignty. The man continues to speak, gesturing with his hands, and the background remains consistent throughout the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker who introduces himself as Martin Endress, the Chief Customer Officer of Ionos. He explains that he will be discussing the strategic partnership between Ionos and Nextcloud. He believes that partnering companies should share the same vision and beliefs. He quotes Ionos CEO Achim Weiss, stating that "Ionos and Nextcloud share the same vision of European data sovereignty." His tone is professional and informative.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a black cardigan over a white shirt stands in front of a white background, gesturing with his hands as he speaks. To his left, a blue graphic displays the logos of IONOS and 1&1, accompanied by the text "IONOS and 1&1 share the same vision." Below this, a quote reads, "The Partnership with Nextcloud is based on the same vision of European data sovereignty," attributed to Achim Weig, CEO of IONOS and founder of 1&1. The man appears to be discussing the partnership and its focus on European data sovereignty, emphasizing the shared vision between IONOS and 1&1. The setting is professional, with a clean and minimalistic design that highlights the message on the graphic.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker addressing the increasing attention towards "data sovereignty" and questioning its meaning. He continues, defining data sovereignty as subject to laws of the country where collected and expressing concern over its current reality. The speaker references the US Cloud Act and the potential for foreign governments to access European data, and he names examples such as "Huawei," "TikTok," and "Nord Stream 2." In a worried tone, he advocates for European technology, mentioning "Nextcloud" and "Ionus" for ensuring European data sovereignty.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a black cardigan over a white shirt stands in front of a white background, gesturing with his hands as he speaks. Behind him, a large screen displays various graphics and text. Initially, the screen shows a blue background with the logos of IONOS and 1&1, accompanied by a quote from Achim Weig, CEO of IONOS and founder of 1&1 Internet AG, emphasizing the partnership with Nextcloud based on European data sovereignty. The screen then transitions to a graphic highlighting IONOS as Europe's leading web hosting group, featuring a world map and statistics such as over 25 million domains, more than 8 million customers, 12 data centers, and over 100,000 servers. The man continues to speak and gesture, emphasizing the points displayed on the screen. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere, focusing on the man's presentation and the detailed information about IONOS's services and achievements.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker, in a formal, informative tone, introduces himself and assumes familiarity with Nextcloud among the conference attendees. He proceeds to provide an overview of 1&1 IONOS, emphasizing its role as Europe's largest web hosting group, its history, and its offerings, including high-performance hosting and cloud services. He also mentions financial metrics and operational scale, such as annual turnover, domains, customers, data centers, and servers. He then lists the different brands within the hosting group, including Strato, FastHosts, Arsys, and Home.pl. He highlights the specialist domain services provided by Internet X and Sedo.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a title screen displaying the text "We are Europe's leading Web Hosting Group..." alongside the IONOS logo, set against a blue world map background. The screen highlights IONOS' scale with statistics such as ">25m Domains," ">8m Customers," "12 Data Centers," and ">100K Servers." The scene transitions to a man in a black sweater and white shirt standing in front of a screen that reads "...building a truly European Cloud Solution." The screen behind him illustrates cloud computing services, including SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS, with corresponding services like Managed Kubernetes, Backup, Operating System, Virtual Machines, Servers, Storage, and Networking & DC Fabric. The man gestures as he speaks, emphasizing the cloud services. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere, focusing on IONOS' cloud solutions and their European presence.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker, in an informative tone, describing their background in hosting and their natural progression to developing a cloud offering. They highlight their deep data center expertise and strength on the infrastructure side, providing standard and individual networking, compute, and storage solutions. He mentions using Kubernetes internally to orchestrate virtual machines, which they now offer as a managed service. The speaker then notes their partnerships with solution providers and collaborations with Nextcloud and OX, emphasizing their willingness to collaborate rather than compete.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man stands in front of a white background, delivering a presentation on cloud solutions. He is dressed in a black sweater over a white shirt, and his facial expressions and hand gestures suggest he is actively explaining the content. Behind him, a large screen displays a slide titled "...building a truly European Cloud Solution" with the logo "IONOS" in the top right corner. The slide outlines three main cloud service models: "Consume" (SaaS), "Build" (PaaS), and "Host" (IaaS). Each model is accompanied by a list of services, such as "Managed Kubernetes," "Backup," "Operating Systems," "Virtual Machines," "Storage," and "Networking & DC Fabric." The man appears to be discussing the features and benefits of these cloud services, emphasizing their relevance to European cloud solutions. The overall setting is professional, with a focus on the presentation content and the speaker's engagement with the audience.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker pondering how one can compete with larger entities that have more resources. He asserts they are not foolish enough to directly compete on all services and geographies, especially at the platform level. He believes it's very possible to compete successfully at the infrastructure level for many customers, use cases, and workloads. He concludes that not everyone needs hundreds of loosely integrated features.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man standing in front of a presentation screen, dressed in a black sweater over a white shirt, gesturing as he speaks. The screen behind him displays a slide titled "...building a truly European Cloud Solution" with a diagram illustrating the cloud service models: SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS, along with their respective components. The slide also includes the logo of IONOS. The man appears to be explaining the content on the screen, emphasizing the cloud service models and their features. The background is a plain white wall, keeping the focus on the presenter and the presentation content. The atmosphere is professional and educational, aimed at informing viewers about the European cloud solution being presented.
events_list.audio_caption: A man speaks in an informative tone, detailing the benefits their company provides, such as performance, security, ease of use, fairness, and openness. He highlights their performance metrics, mentioning being classified as a "rising star" by ISG Provider Lens and surpassing Azure and GCP in compute and storage performance benchmarks. He emphasizes the flexibility of tailoring their offerings to customer needs with customizable vCores, RAM, and storage options.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man standing in front of a large screen displaying a presentation titled "What we guarantee our customers." The man, dressed in a black sweater over a white shirt, gestures with his hands as he speaks, emphasizing the points on the screen. The presentation is divided into five sections, each with a heading and a list of bullet points. The headings are "Performant," "Secure," "Easy-to-use," "Fair," and "Open." Each section includes icons and brief descriptions of the services offered, such as "Geo Redundancy," "Drag-and-Drop Data Center Designer," and "Open Source." The background of the presentation is blue, with the IONOS logo visible in the top right corner. The man appears to be explaining the benefits and features of the services, using hand gestures to highlight key points. The overall atmosphere is professional and informative, with the man engaging the audience through his presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker describing the network level, where InfiniBand is used as the communication standard, a technology usually found in high performance computing. He mentions that security is also key, listing load balancers, firewalls, backup, disaster recovery, and geo-redundancy. He states that they are ISO compliant and fully GDPR compliant. He then adds that, according to the ruling of the European Court of Justice on Privacy Shield, one cannot be GDPR compliant and subject to the US Cloud Act.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a black sweater over a white shirt stands in front of a blue background with a large poster behind him. The poster displays the title "What we guarantee our customers" at the top, followed by five categories: Performant, Secure, Easy-to-use, Fair, and Open. Each category is accompanied by a brief description and a list of features or benefits. The man appears to be explaining the content of the poster, gesturing with his hands to emphasize his points. The setting is professional, with the focus on the man and the poster, creating an informative atmosphere. The video maintains a consistent visual style, with no significant changes in the environment or the man's actions throughout the sequence.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker emphasizing the ease of using services, mentioning a drag-and-drop data center designer. He claims fair prices, without vendor locking tactics or hidden costs, and that performance is always included, unlike the costly boost packages of competitors. He highlights using and giving back to open source to the community, with a dig at a certain competitor. He then transitions into the topic of a next cloud partnership.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man standing in front of a white background, wearing a black cardigan over a white shirt, and speaking to the camera. Behind him, a large screen displays various slides related to a partnership and solutions for different customer types. The first slide, titled "Our partnership started this year," highlights the benefits of NextcloudHub hosted by IONOS, including file-sharing, document collaboration, and communication, with a call to action to rent it now. The second slide, titled "We build solutions for three customer types," outlines the offerings for Enterprise Customers, Public Sector, and Private and SMB, emphasizing high-performance, security, and scalability. The man gestures with his hands as he speaks, emphasizing his points. The slides change to show different aspects of the solutions, with the final slide reiterating the offerings for the three customer types, including the upcoming availability of Private and SMB solutions. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere throughout, with the man's attire and the clean, white background contributing to a formal presentation style.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker excitedly describing a product, "Nextcloud product," and its application for hosting and cloud customers. He mentions an enterprise-grade version hosted in the "IONOS cloud" offering "unlimited storage and user seats" and emphasizes its scalability and enterprise support. No other audio elements are present.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a static image with a blue background, divided into three sections, each representing a different customer type for which solutions are built. The top of the image reads "We build solutions for three customer types." The first section on the left is titled "Enterprise Customers," accompanied by an illustration of a person presenting in front of a large screen displaying charts and graphs. The text below explains that nextcloud on IONOS cloud offers a high-performing instance for Nextcloud admins, with no user or storage limits, and is adaptable to individual business needs. The middle section is labeled "Public Sector," featuring an illustration of a server rack with a person standing beside it. The text describes a highly-secure and scalable infrastructure hosted in Germany, compliant with GDPR, and suitable for sensitive demands, mentioning German Schulcloud and Project Phoenix. The third section on the right is titled "Private and SMB," with an illustration of a person working on a laptop surrounded by server racks. The text highlights the readiness and ease of use of nextcloud without administrative skills, emphasizing a fully managed solution for everyone, with a focus on work-from-home. The IONOS cloud logo is visible in the top right corner, and the phrase "COMING SOON" is noted next to the "Private and SMB" section. The video maintains this static image throughout, with no changes or movements between frames.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing collaboration in the public sector, focusing on digitizing schools, government, civil service, and public authorities in Germany. He emphasizes digital sovereignty, stating data must be subject to German laws and never threatened with shutdown or loss of access, delivered in a serious and informative tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man standing in front of a large screen displaying a presentation slide titled "We build solutions for three customer types." The slide is divided into three sections, each representing a different customer type: Enterprise Customers, Public Sector, and Private and SMB. Each section includes an illustration and a brief description of the services offered. The man, dressed in a black sweater over a white shirt, gestures with his hands as he speaks, likely explaining the content on the screen. The background is plain white, focusing attention on the presenter and the slide. The IONOS logo is visible in the top right corner of the slide, indicating the company behind the presentation. The man appears to be engaged in a professional presentation, possibly for a business or educational setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features one male speaker who speaks in a calm and informative tone, discussing the company's current offering for private customers and SMBs, highlighting its "fully managed, no-frills Nextcloud for everyone" that addresses the needs of work from home and the increased demand for groupware and collaboration solutions during the corona crisis. He expresses happiness in positioning Nextcloud as their technology partner across all customer groups.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a black sweater over a white shirt stands in front of a white background, gesturing with his hands as he speaks. Behind him, a large screen displays a blue graphic with the title "We build solutions for three customer types" and the logo of IONOS. The graphic is divided into three sections, each representing a different customer type: Enterprise Customers, Public Sector, and Private and SMB. Each section includes an illustration and a brief description of the services offered. The man appears to be explaining the content on the screen, using hand gestures to emphasize his points. As the video progresses, the screen changes to a new graphic with the text "This is just the beginning..." and additional information about where to find more details and how to get a cloud server with a 200€ starting credit. The man continues to speak and gesture, maintaining a professional demeanor throughout the presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker expressing optimism about a partnership, encouraging listeners to check out an offering, and inviting questions. He speaks in a positive and confident tone. Following this, he expresses gratitude and wishes listeners to enjoy a conference.
